titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James Long et al., Judgment
CWG5747

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky,
Marion County, SS.
Marion Circuit Court,
August, Term, 1864.
August 15th 1864
Among other things then and there done the following Judgment rendered --

The Commonwealth of Ky. Plff
against. } Summons on Forfeited Bond
James Long, William Harris Green Forrest Rosa Long. and Susan Carrico Defts

The Defendants William Harris, Green Forrest, and Susan Carrico, having been duly summoned and failing to answer; it is adjudged by the Court, the Plaintiff recover of said Defendants, Three Hundred Dollars, the amount of the forfeited Bond, and also her Costs, herein expended: And this cause is continued as to James Long and Rosa Long.

Copy Attest F. B. Merrimee
by John Dyer D. C.
